I am sure this must have been done but I can't find any papers on it.

Has =
anyone tried starting out with an initial population that connects
all the =
inputs to the outputs with a parallel set of neurons using
identity as the =
activation function? Then add a new type of mutation
that can add new neuro=
ns with the identity activation function.

Basically what I am proposing is=
 starting with the same initial NEAT
configuration of all the inputs connec=
ted to the outputs via sigmoids.
But doubling up this configuration with an=
 identical net connected
via the identity activation function.

The whole p=
oint of this would be to create a hybrid network that is
good at capturing =
the linear aspects (A+B, cross product) of the data
and composing it with t=
he non-linear aspects.

But now that I think about it. I guess a good start=
ing question would
be is a Neural Net using only the  Identity activation f=
unction good
at approximating linear functions?

Something like this might =
be good at approximating time series with a
simple linear trend. So you don=
't have to detrend the data.

Thanks,

Shane
